segments.text: The water is just pouring and pouring, and no one is doing anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cabinets are getting soaked, and the floor is turning into a lake.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe the woman hasn’t turned around yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s just standing there, polishing that plate like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are making everything worse by not telling her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I want to yell at them to turn off the faucet before the whole kitchen floods.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But they’re too busy with their cookies to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, like it’s mocking the mess inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t stand watching this anymore.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Someone needs to do something before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR
